title: 2017 Copa do Brasil Finals
text:
The 2017 Copa do Brasil Finals was the final <a href="two-legged%20tie">two-legged tie</a> that decided the <a href="2017%20Copa%20do%20Brasil">2017 Copa do Brasil</a>, the 29th season of the <a href="Copa%20do%20Brasil">Copa do Brasil</a>, Brazil's national cup <a href="association%20football">football</a> tournament organised by the <a href="Brazilian%20Football%20Confederation">Brazilian Football Confederation</a>.
The finals were contested in a two-legged home-and-away format between <a href="Clube%20de%20Regatas%20do%20Flamengo">Flamengo</a>, from <a href="Rio%20de%20Janeiro%20%28state%29">Rio de Janeiro</a>, and <a href="Cruzeiro%20Esporte%20Clube">Cruzeiro</a>, from <a href="Minas%20Gerais">Minas Gerais</a>. Both teams reached the Copa do Brasil finals for the seventh time, and the second time they faced each other in this stage. The first one was in the <a href="2003%20Copa%20do%20Brasil">2003 Copa do Brasil</a> finals.
A draw by CBF was held on 24 August 2017 to determine the home-and-away teams for each leg. The first leg was hosted by Flamengo at <a href="Maracan%C3%A3%20Stadium">Maracanã</a> in <a href="Rio%20de%20Janeiro">Rio de Janeiro</a> on 7 September 2017, while the second leg was hosted by Cruzeiro at <a href="Mineir%C3%A3o">Mineirão</a> in <a href="Belo%20Horizonte">Belo Horizonte</a> on 27 September 2017.
Tied 1–1 on aggregate, <a href="Cruzeiro%20Esporte%20Clube">Cruzeiro</a> defeated <a href="Clube%20de%20Regatas%20do%20Flamengo">Flamengo</a> 5–3 on penalties in the finals to win their fifth title. As champions, Cruzeiro earned the right to play in the <a href="2018%20Copa%20Libertadores">2018 Copa Libertadores</a> Group stage and the <a href="2018%20Copa%20do%20Brasil">2018 Copa do Brasil</a> Round of 16.

Matches.
First leg.
In the second leg of the Semi-finals against Botafogo, <a href="Paolo%20Guerrero">Paolo Guerrero</a> (Flamengo) picked up a yellow card which meant he was suspended for the first leg of the Finals.
In the first leg, Lucas Paquetá, who was selected as Guerrero's substitute, opened the scoring in the 75th minute when he smashed in the rebound after Cruzeiro goalkeeper Fábio blocked a Willian Arão's shot. The equalizer came in the 83th minute when Thiago failed to block a long-range shot from Hudson, allowing De Arrascaeta to take advantage of the rebound.
Second leg.
<a href="Rafael%20S%C3%B3bis">Rafael Sóbis</a> (Cruzeiro), booked in the first leg, and <a href="Thiago%20Rodrigues%20da%20Silva">Thiago</a> (Flamengo), <a href="scaphoid%20fracture">scaphoid fracture</a> of the left hand, were ruled out of the second leg. In the second leg, Cruzeiro and Flamengo drew 0–0 at the end of normal time. Tied 1–1 on aggregate, Cruzeiro won on penalties.
